data.question: What's a hackathon?
data.answer: A hackathon is a 24 hour event where students with similar interests come together to work on a project. You can attend workshops, hear from people in the computer science field and network with students and reps from companies!

data.question: Who can attend?
data.answer: All female and gender non-conforming university students are welcome to attend AthenaHacks! Other students are welcome to apply as a mentor or volunteer (application coming soon!).

data.question: Will AthenaHacks be virtual this year?
data.answer: AthenaHacks will be fully in-person this year! We will be hosting our event on-campus at the University of Southern California.

data.question: When will applications open and close?
data.answer: Hacker Applications open on November 1st, 2023! They are reviewed on a rolling basis, so please apply as soon as possible!

data.question: Do I need to be a CS major or minor?
data.answer: No! This is the perfect place for any student to create their first coding project. We'll have plenty of resources for beginners to get started!

data.question: Does this cost money?
data.answer: Nope! Admission is free! Our sponsors and AthenaHacks will provide you with the free swag!!

data.question: How do teams work?
data.answer: At most teams can have 4 people. You can have your teammates in mind before the event, or you can find a team during our team formation activity before and after opening ceremony!

data.question: Will there be hardware available?
data.answer: We do provide hardware!! We will have Grove Beginner Kits for Arduino and Grove IoT Edition Starter Kits.

data.question: Is there a code of conduct?
data.answer: Yes, we want to make AthenaHacks enjoyable for everyone! We follow MLH's Code of Conduct: here.

data.question: Can I mentor?
data.answer: If you have technical experience with programming or software development, please apply to be a mentor today!

data.question: I want to join the organizing team. Where can I apply?
data.answer: Are you interested in making a huge impact on women in tech? Join AthenaHacks as an organizer! We recruit once a year in the fall for our Programs, Logistics, Finances and Marketing teams.

data.question: Where can I find more info about opportunities and events?
data.answer: If you'd like to stay updated on all things AthenaHacks, subscribe to our newsletter here. We send out links to opportunities, interesting reads, and our favorite songs in every issue!

data.question: Will AthenaHacks reimburse my transportation costs?
data.answer: Unfortunately, we are unable to cover the costs of hackathon travel this year.
